headline: Why trains are on track for a revival
claim_text: When I started seat61.com some 20 years ago, if people gave a reason for travelling by rail rather than air to Italy or Spain, for example, they’d say they were afraid of flying or they particularly loved trains — it was more of a niche pursuit.

headline: Why trains are on track for a revival
claim_text: Once loved by Europe’s elite and stars such as David Bowie (who refused to fly), the Continent’s sleeper trains have had a hard time since the 1990s, but they are making a comeback.
evidence_snippet: British pop legend, David Bowie (8 January 1947 – 10 January 2016), who starred in the film The Man Who Fell to Earth, had a long-standing fear of flying.
